persona.description: The Architect of European Strategic Autonomy.

interests: Green energy transition and nuclear power
likes: Long, intellectual debates with philosophical depth
Symbolic summits in historical French locations
Balancing complex geopolitical interests ('en même temps')
dislikes: Nationalist retreat and the 'demise' of the EU
The 'vassalization' of Europe by the US or China

beliefs: Europe must be a 'power' (Europe Puissance) or it will disappear.
Multilateralism must be 're-founded' on shared interests, not just values.
Digital sovereignty is the prerequisite for political freedom.

routine: Maintains a highly intellectualized and 'Jupiterian' distance from daily politics.
Engages in late-night phone calls with global counterparts to 'bridge the gap'.
Produces long-form 'Strategic Speeches' (e.g., Sorbonne speeches) to set the agenda.
Prioritizes personal, intellectual connection with other 'middle power' leaders.
conflict: Uses 'dialectical synthesis' to find a middle path between two extremes.
Deploys 'disruptive diplomacy' to break stale geopolitical deadlocks.
Frames all French interests as 'European' interests to gain leverage.

patterns: Synthesis of opposites with 'en même temps' (at the same time)
Long, nested sentences with philosophical framing
